Python Selenium automation testing

355 Ratings3065 Learners

A complete hands-on course which covers scripting using Core Python and basic-to-advanced concepts of Selenium WebDriver. Test automation is an enormous time-saver, and it's crucial to continuous integration, continuous delivery, and agile software development.

course-benefits

  • By the end of this course you will be able to automate any web application using Python and Selenium.
  • You will be able to design different Test Automation Frameworks like: Page Object Model, BDD using Cucumber etc based on client requirement.
  • You will be able to generate content rich reports using reporting tool like Allure.
  • Atlast, you can crack any interview in the field of Automation Testing and can successfully secure a position in IT.

Python-Selenium Course Syllabus

Python-Selenium Course

  • Basic of Python, Python program structure.
  • Elements of python language.
  • The Python Interpreter.
  • Data Types and Control Flow.
  • Class in Python, functions.
  • Inheritance, Errors and Exceptions, Modules, Input and Output, Assertions, PIP.
  • Utilities like: Excel Reading, Log generation, sending Automation email, Database connectivity etc.
  • Basics of Selenium WebDriver 3.0
  • Advanced concepts of Selenium WebDriver 3.0
  • Pytest Framework ,Parallel test execution.
  • Data Driven Framework.
  • Page Object Model Design Pattern.
  • Behave BDD Framework.

Python Basics part-I

  1. Python program structure
  2. Elements of python language
  3. Running first program in python
  4. writing first java program

Python Basics Part-II

  1. Introduction to data types Control Flows
  2. Operators
  3. Functions and Variables Data Structures
  4. Lists and More

Python Basics Part-III (OOPS Concept)

  1. Classes
  2. Names and Objects
  3. Inheritance
  4. Iterators
  5. Generators
  6. Python Standard Libraries

Python Basics Part-IV

  1. Errors and Exceptions
  2. Modules
  3. Input and Output
  4. Assertions
  5. PIP

Locators

  1. What are locators
  2. Types of locators
  3. Examples of using Locators
  4. Advantages and disadvantages of using locators

Web Driver Part-I

  1. Introduction of Web Driver
  2. Download & configuring Web driver
  3. The architecture of selenium web driver
  4. Drivers for Firefox, IE, chrome, I-phone, Android
  5. First Selenium Code
  6. Introduction to basic commands like get/navigate
  7. Exception Handling in Selenium

Web Driver Part-II

  1. Working with web page elements/Controls o Dropdown
  2. Listbox
  3. Radio buttons
  4. Multi-select box o Date picker
  5. Combobox widget
  6. Introducing wait – implicit and explicit wait
  7. Handling different browsers – Firefox, Chrome and Internet Explorer browser
  8. Taking screenshots
  9. Handling Java script alerts, confirmations and prompts

Web Driver Part-III

  1. Working with Windows, Tabs and Frames
  2. Working with static and dynamic Web tables
  3. ACTIONS CLASS FOR MOUSE AND KEYBOARD ACTIONS

Web Driver Part-IV

  1. File Upload and Download
  2. Working with Proxy APIs PyTest Framework
  3. Introduction to PyTest framework
  4. Installing PyTest
  5. PyTest Fixtures
  6. Running multiple tests using PyTest
  7. Generating Test
  8. report Data-Driven Testing
  9. Reading and writing data from Excel/XML
  10. Writing automation scripts to use excel data Page Object Model (POM)
  11. What is Page Object Model (POM)
  12. Concept of Object Repository
  13. Need for POM
  14. Page Factory
  15. Implementing POM
  16. Automation Framework Basics

Introduction to Jenkins

  1. What is Jenkins
  2. Installation and configuration of Jenkins
  3. Plugins in Jenkins
  4. Setting up a Jenkins Job
  5. Manage Jenkins Job
